frames.text: YOU THERE! You look like a man who honours and fears the gods. Not like one of those godless eggheads that lounge around the stoas. Prove it by answering me twelve questions for the twelve gods! What say you?
frames.text2: Aha, back again, are you? Are you ready to prove what you know about the twelve gods?

options.text: Very well, but I'd better not get smitten down if I get something wrong.
Gladly, I am well known for my piety and my humility.

frames.text: INCORRECT! You have been judged and found wanting! You had better go to the temple of Hephaestus and hang your head in shame.
Excellent, excellent. Prove your worth in the eyes of the gods! The first question concerns the almighty Zeus, father of the gods: what is Zeus' weapon of choice?
Who is the wife of Zeus?
That's right! And now for our own beloved goddess. When Athena was battling with Poseidon for this land, what was the gift she offered to the Athenians?
Any true Athenian would know that, of course. You see it as soon as you look at the Parthenon. But can you answer this? What is the attribute of Artemis?
frames.info: A god's attribute is, of course, an object which they use and which symbolises them.

options.prefix: A spinning wheel is not too much use for the goddess of the hunt, is it! Peh.

frames.text: Correct! On to Artemis' twin, then. What is his name?
Quite right. Next question! Which goddess is often accompanied by Cupid?

options.prefix: What? What would Cupid be doing in the underworld with Persephone?

frames.text: From the prettiest god to the ugliest... It's time to see what you know about Hephaestus. Where does he spend most of his time?

options.prefix: Did you really think we'd build a temple to a god who does nothing?

frames.text: You're right again! On to Ares now. The god of what?
Well done. We seafaring Athenians have much respect for Poseidon, but he's not only the god of the sea. For what else is he honoured?
Indeed. Only three gods left. Every year in the Spring we present something to Demeter, goddess of fertile land. What is it?

options.text: The first of our crops and fruit
Some of our childrens' old clothes

frames.text: Correct! Hermes, the god of messengers and travellers. What does he wear on his feet?
Yes, that's right. And now for the god we honour every year with our tragedies and comedies in the Theatre. Name one of the gifts which Dionysus gave to us.

All twelve questions answered correctly! You are truly a pious man, of whom the whole city can be proud. Of course, there are many gods besides the twelve Olympians. For your piety, please accept this - a statue of Aesclypius, the god of healing. Go on your way and may the gods bless you.
